studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 5.1 - Overall Study Design and Plan
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Mandatory dose reduction for all subjects currently on 30 mg QD to 15 mg QD.
Implementation of virtual visits, remote monitoring, and direct-to-patient drug shipment due to pandemic conditions.
Updated AST/ALT laboratory toxicity management guidelines and COVID-19 interruption rules.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: The dose of 15 mg QD has been determined to be the optimal dose and is the proposed dose for marketing authorization globally.
To provide flexibility in conduct of study visits and procedures during state of emergency/pandemic times.
To update study drug name to the appropriate generic name.

studyChanges.beforeText: Subjects will continue to receive upadacitinib 15 mg QD or upadacitinib 30 mg QD, respectively
studyChanges.afterText: Upon approval of protocol amendment 8, subjects receiving upadacitinib 30 mg QD will be switched to upadacitinib 15 mg QD at their next scheduled study visit.
studyChanges.summary: Global dose switch from 30mg to 15mg for all active subjects.
Updated investigational product name to generic name throughout protocol.

studyChanges.afterText: subject visits may be conducted via phone or video conference and that vital signs and weight may be performed by the subject or caregiver as needed
studyChanges.summary: Added provisions for virtual study visits and remote assessments.

studyChanges.afterText: acute, spontaneous perforation of the gastrointestinal tract that requires inpatient medical care or urgent surgical intervention
studyChanges.summary: Refined definition of gastrointestinal perforation for toxicity management.

studyChanges.afterText: update AST/ALT laboratory toxicity management guidelines for ALT or AST > 8 Ã— ULN
studyChanges.summary: Updated threshold and management for hepatic lab abnormalities.
